question.title: Trying to reference PDFBox library in VS Code - error thrown
question.body:
I am trying to use the Apache PDFBox JAR, but get an error when I compile the code.

I have downloaded the JAR (pdfbox-3.0.4.jar) and put it in the root directory for my Java project. In VS Code, I have went to "Referenced Libraries" and clicked the plus icon in order to add the JAR as a referenced library, but get this error when I compile the code:

merge.java:4: error: package org.apache.pdfbox does not exist
import org.apache.pdfbox.Loader;
                        ^
merge.java:5: error: package org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel does not exist
import org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.PDDocument;
                                ^
merge.java:6: error: package org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel does not exist
import org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.PDPage;
                                ^
merge.java:20: error: cannot find symbol
        PDDocument document = Loader.loadPDF(file);
        ^
  symbol:   class PDDocument
  location: class merge
merge.java:20: error: cannot find symbol
        PDDocument document = Loader.loadPDF(file);
                              ^
  symbol:   variable Loader
  location: class merge
merge.java:24: error: cannot find symbol
        document.addPage(new PDPage());
                             ^
  symbol:   class PDPage
  location: class merge
6 errors

question_comments.body: Have you EVER succeeded in building a java project with an external library on VS Code? If yes, what was different?

And exactly how are you trying to compile? As an aside, dedicated Java IDEs like IntelliJ IDEA or Eclipse are usually better than VS Code. You'll also want to consider Maven or Gradle to manage your dependencies.
